data.text:
@jojomay1 @gsyblue @YvonneBurford @ElevenGg @DrNicolaBrink If they don’t publish then that “unknown” will make many feel uncomfortable whilst others will shout, “CONSPIRACY!”

Publishing figures, even with the associated inaccuracies of relying on public to report, is the best middle-ground, unless we go back to full PCR test rules.

@gsyblue @YvonneBurford @ElevenGg @DrNicolaBrink I don’t disagree that Dr Brink and her team need it & they’ve always kept us well informed with advice etc but, it is the publishing that I don’t feel necessary.  My opinion (& actually many of the business leaders I work with)

@jojomay1 @YvonneBurford @ElevenGg They are the minimum/ best case scenario .  @DrNicolaBrink and team needs the data to plan, impact assess for their ‘business’ as does many others. Do we cancel staff holidays at Easter or implement WFH strategy again? Every industry needs info on what is going on around them
@gsyblue @YvonneBurford @ElevenGg But, they’re not accurate, they add nothing to any risk calculation.

@jojomay1 @YvonneBurford @ElevenGg Figures enable business & islanders to assess the risk. With 1 in 40 islanders having covid, it’s easy to continue to advise to WFH or current impact, getting staff not sick to work their weekend and do longer hours.
@YvonneBurford Yes masks were dropped too soon, “living with Covid” is almost becoming “being controlled by Covid”

@YvonneBurford @ElevenGg Exactly Yvonne.  I am not sure why they are publicizing figures at all now.  I’m led to believe that some are not testing at all and, many are not reporting it when they do get a positive.  To me this just says 1,527 people have filled in a form.
@ElevenGg I’m not sure it would tell us any more than we already know which is it is totally rife in the community now.
@YvonneBurford Considering the numbers are rising the statistics on Covid should be published more than once a week.
